boat.construction_details: Iroko on Oak with Teak laid Decks
boat.full_description:
Falcon II was built in 1936 and remained available to hire until the early 1960's. After passing into private ownership she was sailed on the Norfolk Broads regularly until 1997. During this time various alterations were made to her length and keel to improve her sailing qualities.

In 1997 Falcon II was taken to the International Boat Building College in Lowestoft where she would remain for around 15 years. By 2012 her then owner had completed a major refit and restoration. Little is known of what happend over the next 7 years but by 2019 and suffering from neglect, major work was needed once again.

A change of ownership (only her 4th owner since leaving the hire fleet of John Loynes) and initial refurbishment works were completed by the summer of 2021 which included a new keel, planking and a new engine. Built with oak frames and iroko planking, she is unusal for a Broads Yacht due to her teak decks. The cabin side and cockpit are mahogony and the mast, boom, gaff and bow sprit are Douglas fir. With her restoration more or less complete, Falcon II is professionally maintained at a boatyard in Wroxham and is now regularly sailed on the Broads once more.
boat.name: Falcon II
boat.short_description: Built originally as a class of 2 by John Loynes and Sons Originally built for their hire fleet on the Norfolk Broads.
